Attach script files to a MID Server

Users can attach a script file, such as a PowerShell script file to a MID Server and synchronize the file to that MID Server. The synchronization of the script file from the ServiceNow instance to the connected MID Server continues to work as if the script was manually added to the form. If there are multiple attachments, the last attached file gets synchronized to the MID Server. If you delete the attachment, the script file becomes inactive, and the synchronized file is deleted from MID Server.
Note: The script file attachment name must match the MID Server script file name, since the record can contain other attachments.
  1. Select Use attachment, and then click the paperclip icon to add the attachment.
    Note: When Use attachment is checked, an attached script file overrides the script contained in the Script field. If this check box is cleared, the script in the Script field is used instead of the attachment.
  2. Click Update to initiate the synchronization process.
    Ensure that the file name matches the script name.
    Note: If you receive the error message: File type not permitted or mime type does not match the file content, request that your administrator turn off mime type validation on attachments. The system property glide.security.file.mime_type.validation controls this setting.
